verses.kjv: Now it came to pass after this, that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Some time later, Nahash the king of the Ammonites died, and his son became king after him.

verses.kjv: And David said, I will shew kindness unto Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father shewed kindness to me. And David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. So the servants of David came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.
verses.ct: David said, "I want to show loyalty to Hanun son of Nahash, since his father treated me with kindness." So David sent representatives to express sympathy to Hanun about his father's death. When David's officials arrived in the land of the Ammonites to bring comfort to Hanun,

verses.kjv: But the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, Thinkest thou that David doth honour thy father, that he hath sent comforters unto thee? are not his servants come unto thee for to search, and to overthrow, and to spy out the land?
verses.ct: the Ammonite leaders said to Hanun, "Do you really think David is honoring your father by sending people to console you? Haven't his officials come here to scout out the land, gather intelligence, and plan its overthrow?"

verses.kjv: Wherefore Hanun took David’s servants, and shaved them, and cut off their garments in the midst hard by their buttocks, and sent them away.
verses.ct: So Hanun seized David's officials, shaved off their beards, cut their clothing in half at the waist — exposing their backsides — and sent them away.

verses.kjv: Then there went certain, and told David how the men were served. And he sent to meet them: for the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said, Tarry at Jericho until your beards be grown, and then return.
verses.ct: When someone went and told David how his men had been treated, he sent word to meet them, because they were deeply humiliated. The king told them, "Stay in Jericho until your beards have grown back, and then come home."

verses.kjv: And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire them chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia, and out of Syriamaachah, and out of Zobah.
verses.ct: When the Ammonites realized they had made themselves repulsive to David, Hanun and the Ammonites sent 1,000 talents of silver to hire chariots and cavalry from Mesopotamia, from Aram-maachah, and from Zobah.

verses.kjv: So they hired thirty and two thousand chariots, and the king of Maachah and his people; who came and pitched before Medeba. And the children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to battle.
verses.ct: They hired 32,000 chariots along with the king of Maachah and his troops, who came and set up camp near Medeba. The Ammonites also assembled from their towns and marched out for war.

verses.kjv: And when David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all the host of the mighty men.
verses.ct: When David learned about this, he sent Joab with the entire army of elite warriors.

verses.kjv: And the children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array before the gate of the city: and the kings that were come were by themselves in the field.
verses.ct: The Ammonites came out and formed their battle lines at the entrance to the city, while the kings who had come as allies positioned themselves separately in the open field.

verses.kjv: Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose out of all the choice of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians.
verses.ct: When Joab realized he was facing an attack from both the front and the rear, he selected the best soldiers in Israel and arranged them in formation against the Arameans.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the people he delivered unto the hand of Abishai his brother, and they set themselves in array against the children of Ammon.
verses.ct: He placed the remaining troops under the command of his brother Abishai, and they formed up to face the Ammonites.

verses.kjv: And he said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me: but if the children of Ammon be too strong for thee, then I will help thee.
verses.ct: Joab told him, "If the Arameans are too powerful for me, you come and rescue me. But if the Ammonites overpower you, I'll come to your aid."

verses.kjv: Be of good courage, and let us behave ourselves valiantly for our people, and for the cities of our God: and let the LORD do that which is good in his sight.
verses.ct: "Stand strong! Let's fight bravely for our people and for the cities of our God. And may the LORD do what he considers right."

verses.kjv: So Joab and the people that were with him drew nigh before the Syrians unto the battle; and they fled before him.
verses.ct: Then Joab and his troops advanced toward the Arameans for battle, and the Arameans retreated from him.

verses.kjv: And when the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians were fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother, and entered into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: When the Ammonites saw that the Arameans had run away, they also fled from Joab's brother Abishai and withdrew into the city. Then Joab returned to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And when the Syrians saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they sent messengers, and drew forth the Syrians that were beyond the river: and Shophach the captain of the host of Hadarezer went before them.
verses.ct: When the Arameans realized they had been defeated by Israel, they sent for reinforcements — Aramean forces from beyond the Euphrates River. Shophach, the commander of Hadarezer's army, led them.

verses.kjv: And it was told David; and he gathered all Israel, and passed over Jordan, and came upon them, and set the battle in array against them. So when David had put the battle in array against the Syrians, they fought with him.
verses.ct: When David received this report, he assembled all of Israel, crossed the Jordan River, and advanced against them, arranging his forces for battle. When David lined up against the Arameans, they engaged him in combat.

verses.kjv: But the Syrians fled before Israel; and David slew of the Syrians seven thousand men which fought in chariots, and forty thousand footmen, and killed Shophach the captain of the host.
verses.ct: But the Arameans fled from Israel. David killed 7,000 of their chariot fighters and 40,000 foot soldiers, and he also killed Shophach, the army commander.

verses.kjv: And when the servants of Hadarezer saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they made peace with David, and became his servants: neither would the Syrians help the children of Ammon any more.
verses.ct: When Hadarezer's allies saw that Israel had defeated them, they made peace with David and submitted to him. After that, the Arameans refused to help the Ammonites ever again.
